intro: Carex urelytra, commonly known as narrowleaf sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, bogs, and along stream banks. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are usually arranged in three ranks, a characteristic feature of the sedge family. Its inflorescence consists of a spiky, cylindrical cluster of small, wind-pollinated flowers. Carex urelytra plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
